definitions.definition: A chemical that binds to a receptor but does not produce a physiological response, blocking the action of other agonist chemicals, such as endogenous chemical messengers .
The main character or force opposing the protagonist in a literary work or drama.
A muscle that acts in opposition to another.
examples: A flexor, which bends a part, is the antagonist of an extensor, which extends it.

secondary_definitions: ( biochemistry ) A chemical that binds to a receptor but does not produce a physiological response, blocking the action of other agonist chemicals, such as endogenous chemical messengers .
( authorship ) The main character or force opposing the protagonist in a literary work or drama.
( anatomy ) A muscle that acts in opposition to another.
